name

name

  1. Estremoz (a city and municipality in modern Évora district, Alentejo region, Portugal)

name
  1. Évora (a city and municipality, the capital of modern Évora district, Alentejo region, Portugal)

name
  1. Faro (a city in the Algarve region, in modern Portugal)

name
  1. Recceswinth, Visigothic king of Hispania from 649 to 672

name
  1. Rome (the ancient capital of the Roman Empire; capital city of the Papal States, in modern-day Italy)

noun
  1. abbot (superior or head of an abbey or monastery)

noun
  1. abbess (female superior of a nunnery or convent)

verb
  1. to fall asleep (to pass from a state of wakefulness into sleep)

noun
  1. (music) a traditional square tambourine of Moorish origin

adv
  1. (sometimes before a vowel) Apocopic form of agora.

noun
  1. alb (long white robe worn by priests and other ministers)
  2. dawn

noun
  1. (sometimes before a vowel) Apocopic form of amigo or amiga.

verb
  1. to evil-eye (to cast an evil eye upon someone or something)
  2. to look

noun
  1. a place with an abundance of hollies

noun
  1. holly (any of various shrubs or small trees of the genus Ilex)

noun
  1. goshawk (bird of prey in the genus Accipiter)

noun
  1. crossbowman (someone (usually a soldier) equipped with a crossbow)

noun
  1. beast (a non-human animal, especially large vertebrate quadrupeds)
  2. beast of burden, donkey

column2:
noun
  1. way (road, a direction, a (physical or conceptual) path from one place to another)

verb
  1. to sing (to produce music with one’s voice)

verb
  1. to look; to observe; to examine
  2. to look for
  3. to consider

noun
  1. knight (mediaeval warrior)
  2. a noble ranked below an infançon and above an escudeiro

verb
  1. (Christianity, transitive) to communicate (to administer the Holy Communion)
  2. (Christianity, intransitive) to communicate (to take part in Holy Communion)

verb
  1. to lay (to place down in a position of rest, or in a horizontal position)

noun
  1. (uncountable, Christianity) the Devil; Satan
  2. a devil; a demon

verb
  1. to take off (a shoe)
  2. to take off one's shoes

conj
  1. and (expresses two elements to be taken together or in addition to each other)

adj
  1. strong; powerful (capable of producing great physical force)
  2. (of wind, water, etc.) strong; fast moving etc.
  3. (of a disease or symptom) strong; severe

noun
  1. dolphin (carnivorous aquatic mammal)
  2. marauder (one who moves about in roving fashion looking for plunder)

adj
  1. grey (having a colour between white and black)

noun
  1. hermitage
  2. an isolated chapel, shrine or other sanctuary, often in the care of a hermit or anchorite

noun
  1. a noble ranked below a ricome and above a cavaleiro

noun
  1. an hagiographic work (biography of a Christian saint)

verb
  1. to take (to carry to a particular destination)

noun
  1. crumb (small piece which breaks off from baked food)

noun
  1. millet (a group of various types of grass or its grains)

adv
  1. not even (introduces an emphatic negation or exclusion)

conj
  1. nor (introduces each except the first term of a series, indicating that none of them is true)

noun
  1. an icon (religious painting)
  2. a statue, a religious image

noun
  1. man (male adult human being)
  2. man (the human race in its entirety)

noun
  1. a granary placed on top of pillars

noun
  1. goldsmith (craftsman who makes things out of gold)

noun
  1. shovel; spade (tool for digging and moving material)

noun
  1. people (a group of two or more persons)
  2. people (a group of persons forming or belonging to a particular nation or ethnic group)
